citation.article-title: Thalassospira tepidiphila sp. nov., a polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon-degrading bacterium isolated from seawater.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Thalassospira tepidiphila sp. nov.
Thalassospira tepidiphila (te.pi.di.phi′la. L. adj. tepidus lukewarm; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. fem. adj. tepidiphila lukewarm-loving, mesophilic).
Cells are Gram-negative, vibrioid to spiral, 0.17–0.33 μm wide and 0.9–2.0 μm long.
Cells are motile by means of single polar flagella.
Colonies on MB Gelrite are smooth, convex, opaque and slightly yellow.
In the API 20NE test, negative for glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase and gelatinase activity.
NaCl is required for growth; optimum growth occurs with 3 % NaCl and the range is 2–14 %.
The optimum growth temperature is 43 °C (range, 8–45 °C) and the optimum pH is 7.0 (range, pH 5.0–10.0).
Facultatively anaerobic; nitrate is reduced to nitrite under anaerobic conditions, but nitrite is not reduced to nitrogen (nitrite is the final product of nitrate reduction).

In Biolog GN2 plates, the following are utilized as carbon sources: Tween 40, l-arabinose, d-arabitol, cellobiose, d-fucose, d-galactose, α-d-glucose, myo-inositol, d-mannitol, d-mannose, methyl pyruvate, acetic acid, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, d-glucosaminic acid, d-glucuronic acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, dl-lactic acid, quinic acid, succinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, d-alanine, l-alanine, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, glycyl l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, hydroxy-l-proline, l-proline, l-pyroglutamic acid, l-serine, γ-aminobutyric acid, urocanic acid and glycerol.

The following are utilized weakly: glycogen, Tween 80, d-psicose, formic acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, d-galacturonic acid, d-gluconic acid, malonic acid, propionic acid, succinamic acid and l-alanyl glycine.
Degrades naphthalene, phenanthrene, dibenzothiophene and fluorene (mixed into crude oil).
The major cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C16 : 0 and C17 : 0 cyclo.
The genomic DNA G+C content of the type strain is 55.1±0.4 mol%.
The type strain, 1-1BT (=JCM 14578T =DSM 18888T), was isolated from petroleum-contaminated seawater in a beach-simulation tank during a bioremediation experiment.
